intro: Hieracium romieuxianum, commonly known as the Romieux's hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow with ray florets. Hieracium romieuxianum is often found in rocky areas and is adapted to withstand harsh environmental conditions.
